sentence.value: Bertram Raoul Bulkin (July 20, 1929 — March 10, 2012) was an American aeronautical engineer who participated in the first U.S. photo-reconnaissance satellite programs and is best known for his role in building the Hubble Space Telescope.
sentence.annotated-sentence: null
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: null

sentence.value: As Lockheed's Program Manager for the Large Space Telescope, Bulkin accompanied senior Lockheed officials to hearings before the House of Representatives' Subcommittee on Space Science and Applications on June 16, 1983 and took several questions from the panel on cost, schedule, and performance concerns related to the telescope project.
